intro: Gerardia villosa var. heterophylla, commonly known as the hairy gerardia, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, serrated edge. This variant is noted for its variability in leaf shape, which contributes to its scientific name "heterophylla."
